paper_title.ja: Normal Mode Analysis of Methyl Palumirate All-traus and disordered Forms in wagging Progressive Region

paper_title.en: Normal Mode Analysis of Methyl Palumirate All-traus and disordered Forms in wagging Progressive Region
Normal mode analysis of syndiotactic polypropylene (T(2)G(2)T(6)G(2)) form

description.en: Syndiotactic polypropylene of all-trans form is transformed to (T(2)G(2)T(6)G(2)) form (new form) on exposing to xylene vapor under tension. This new form was characterized by infrared spectra and normal mode analysis. By increasing the gauche component from the all-trans to the new form, the infrared intensities of some bands increase. The potential energy distributions (PED) and L vectors for six monomers, which compose the repeating unit, were investigated. As a result, the PED and L vectors of the conformation-sensitive bands were found to be localized at the gauche position. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Infrared Study on Thermal Stractural Change of Zinc Polmitate

publication_name.en: Proc. XXVI Europian Congress on Molecular Spectroscopy

paper_title.en: Vibrational Study on Structure Transitions of Pottasium Peralgonate CH<sub>3</sub>(CH<sub>2</sub>)<sub>n</sub>CO<sub>2</sub>K
Infrared study on structure and transition behavior of zinc palmitate

description.en: Zinc palmitate has one solid-liquid-phase transition at 137 degreesC. This thermal transition is not reversible. The transition temperature, the enthalpy and the entropy changes are sufficiently high compared with those of normal alkane and normal fatty acid having the same carbon number. At the transition, the alkyl chains go into liquid-like conformation, and the geometrical distortion of the carboxylate groups around the zinc atom occurs.

paper_title.en: Infrared study on annealing effect on conformation of zinc palmitate

description.en: The molecular conformation and the thermal transition behavior of two zinc palmitate specimens, unannealed one and annealed one, were compared. The unannealed specimen has one thermal phase transition at 137 degreesC. Annealing was made by increasing temperature to 150 degreesC and cooling to room temperature slowly. The observed frequencies of all bands of the unannealed specimen at room temperature are assigned to the all- trans conformation. We found new bands at 907, 880, 869, 793, 765 and 689 cm(-1) for the annealed specimen. These new bands are assigned to the TGT conformation a! the COO end, where T means trans and G means gauche. The annealed specimen consists of almost all-trans molecules, but partial molecules have the TGT conformation. The annealed specimen has two thermal phase transitions. As temperature increases TGT molecules change to more energetically stable all- trans conformation at the first phase transition at 100 degreesC. At the second phase transition at 133 degreesC, the all-trans molecules go into liquid-like conformation.

paper_title.en: Infrared and XAFS study on structure and transition behavior of zinc stearate

description.en: Structure and transition behavior of zinc(II) stearate crystal were investigated by infrared and XAFS spectroscopies. Structure of zinc stearate at room temperature was estimated as follows. From XAFS analysis, the coordination number of the carboxylate groups around the zinc atom was evaluated as 4 and the Zn-O distance as 1.95 Angstrom. Based on the infrared spectrum and a normal mode analysis, the conformation of the alkyl chain was confirmed as all-trans and the sub-cell packing was considered as parallel type, and also the coordination form of the carboxylate groups was determined as bridging bidentate type. As increasing temperature, zinc stearate has a solid-liquid phase transition at 130 degrees C. At the transition, the alkyl chains goes into liquid like state as reported by Mesubi but the coordination structure was confirmed to be maintained. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: SPECTROCHIMICA ACTA PART A-MOLECULAR AND BIOMOLECULAR SPECTROSCOPY

paper_title.en: Infrared and XAFS study on internal structural change of ion aggregate in a zinc salt of poly(ethylene-co-methacrylic acid) ionomer on water absorption

description.en: The internal structural change of an ion aggregate in a zinc salt of poly(ethylene-co-methacrylic acid) ionomer on the water absorption-desorption process was investigated by infrared and XAFS spectroscopies. In the infrared carboxylate antisymmetric stretch region, a prominent spectral change was found. In a wet state, the singlet at 1584 cm(-1) appeared, while in a dry state the triplet at 1537, 1554, and 1625 cm(-1) was observed. The spectral change was reversible with respect to the water content. From the XAFS analysis, the Zn-O distance and the coordination number were evaluated as 1.95 Angstrom and 4, respectively, in both the wet and dry states. The coordination form of the carboxylate groups around the zinc atom was considered as the bridging bidentate form in the two states. The large infrared spectral change was ascribed to a little reversible geometrical distortion of the tetrahedral coordination structure in the ion aggregate.

paper_title.en: Crystal Structure of N, N'-Distearyl-1, 4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]-octane Dibromide
Crystal structure of 4-chloro-2-methyl phenol and its infrared study on phase transition

description.en: The crystal structure of 4-chloro-2-methyl phenol was determined, revealing that the crystal belongs to the orthorhombic system with space group P2(1) 2(1) 2(1), a = 20.330 (3), b = 22.399 (4), c = 4.578 (1) A, and z = 12. Molecules stack with benzene rings almost parallel and form two types of hydrogen bond along the c axis. Infrared. spectra were studied in relation to the phase transition below room temperature. The bandwidth of COH bends change following the activation process above T-c and the critical feature below T-c, indicating disorder in COH groups and an ordering due to the long-range interaction, respectively. The infrared intensity change of OH torsions supports also the order-disorder type of phase transition of the second order and T-c = 188 K.

paper_title.en: Vibrational spectra and structures of zinc carboxylates I. Zinc acetate dihydrate

description.en: The crystal structure of zinc acetate dihydrate was re-refined by X-ray diffraction analysis of the single crystal. The monoclinic cell dimensions were revised as a = 14.394 (3), b = 5.330 (2), c = 10.962 (3) Angstrom and beta = 99.8 (2)degrees with Z = 4. The bond distances and bond angles were also refined. Based on the structure, a normal mode analysis was made and the valence force constants were determined. Precise spectral assignments were made. Based on the assignments and the structure, the relation between the coordination forms and the vibrational frequencies of the carboxylate antisymmetric stretch and the symmetric stretch were discussed. In order to identify the coordination form of the carboxylate group from the vibrational frequencies, we propose the importance of other carboxylate modes other than the stretches. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
